cheatsheet.title: Generate a JAX-WS Client from a WSDL document using Apache CXF

intro.description: This cheat sheet will guide you through the individual steps to generate a JAX-WS client from a WSDL document using Apache CXF.

item.title: Generate a JAX-WS client from a WSDL document
item.description: To generate a JAX-WS client from a WSDL document perform the following steps.

subitem.label: Select "File -> New -> Other..." from the main menu, expand the "Web Services" category and choose "Web Service Client". Click "OK". Select the "Click to perform" button below to do this automatically.
Enter the URI to the remote WSDL file that will be used to generate the client.
Verify that "Apache CXF 2.x" is selected as the "Web service runtime".
Select the "Client project" link to choose the project in to which the JAX-WS client will be generated.
Move the client slider position to "Develop Client" and click "Finish".

item.title: Run the JAX-WS client
item.description:
Before running the client check the operation parameters that CXF generated for you and edit if necessary.
To run your client, right-click on the client in the Project Explorer and select Run As > Java Application. A new console view will open and display the responses of the operation invocations.
